Welcome! Status 418 I'm a teapot is a real HTTP status code that exists to declare one simple truth: teapots don't brew coffee.

Born from an April Fools' joke in 1998, this status code somehow stuck around and became a quirky part of web development lore. Here we'll look at its history, explore the HTTP protocol bits that make it work, and see why it's still hanging around today.

Any attempt to brew coffee with a teapot should result in the error code "418 I'm a teapot". The resulting entity body MAY be short and stout.
